title: Preparation for Group Meeting
text:
To be ready to participate in this session’s group meeting:


+ Make sure you have completed all the readings, taken notes, answered the questions, and participated in the group discussion threads.

+ Complete the Mark of Discipleship section below.

 

Mark of Discipleship

 

Revisit this session’s Human Condition:

 

Because we have the capacity to make choices, we see ourselves as self-sufficient. We become self-centered. And because we want no limits placed on us, we rebel against our Creator in our attempt to take control. Yet we know that there is turmoil in the world and in ourselves, but we don’t know why.

 

Now consider this session’s Mark of Discipleship, the Christian response to this Human Condition.

 

Disciples acknowledge their rebellion, accept responsibility for their sin, and repent.

 

In our meeting this week, we will discuss our definition of sin. In preparation, answer the following questions.

question: What is your definition of sin?
We all try to hide our sinfulness, even from ourselves. Recall a time when some person or some event caused you to see your sinful nature.

Because we tend to defy God and take life into our own hands, how do we go about putting ourselves back under God’s authority? (Consider David’s example in Psalm 51.) How do you think repentance factors into this?
We are part of the collective wickedness of the world. Humans have the capability of destroying ourselves. What, in your view, are the means of our survival?
